website_summaries.verdict: When it comes to comfort, support, and fit, the Scarpa Moraine GTX goes all out. These qualities already make the shoe enticing to own, and yet it goes the extra mile by having remarkable water protection. Having said that, some people might find its break-in period rather disconcerting. To sum up, getting the Scarpa Moraine GTX for all its splendid features is a smart choice, especially if would-be owners can put up with its break-in time.
pros: Many wearers, including some with wide feet, found a satisfying fit in the Moraine GTX
Its fantastic level of comfort astonished a large percentage of the reviewing community
Numerous reviewers were compelled to give the Scarpa Moraine GTX praising remarks for its excellent support system
Its waterproofing feature was strongly admired by a good number of users
More than a handful of wearers greatly appreciated the shoe for its superb ventilation
Experts loved the amazing lightness of the Moraine GTX
A few testers swore by the exemplary traction offered by this hiking shoe
This footgear was applauded by a couple of reviewers for being surprisingly flexible
cons: Less than a handful of owners were let down by the shoe’s outsole for wearing down too soon
A small group of gear testers were not happy with its requirement of a break-in period

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Great Quality, Compares Well to Older styles
customer_reviews.text: My last pair of scarpa hiking shoes lasted 9 years and I used them a lot. I was very pleased to find this newer style felt just as comfortable (like VERY comfortable!) and is excellent in wet weather. I love how lightweight and environmentally friendly they are. My only worry at first was that the eyelets of my old scarpa were closer together when you pulled the laces closed, so I thought that the middle part wouldn't be so protected, but it's totally fine. They are a great shoe!!
customer_reviews.author: V&V

customer_reviews.title: Hubby LOVES these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Hubby has a difficult time finding shoes that fit and don't hurt his feet. He LOVES these shoes. He can finally take long walks with me!!!
customer_reviews.author: Boni

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with a lot of shoes fitting both in length and width. I am normally a 10.5 , D width. I need support for walking and hiking, plus stability. These fit perfectly. they are comfortable out of the box. Very flexible but supportive and stable. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: russell ochs

customer_reviews.title: Serious Comfort
customer_reviews.text: These were comfortable right out of the box. Bought them to wear at work, I spend a lot of time on my feet which includes stairs, time on the production floor and in the office. They are comfortable enough for all day wear yet look smart enough for work. Very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: SteveP

customer_reviews.title: Scarpa knows what’s up
customer_reviews.text: Incredible. Best lightweight hiking shoe I’ve ever worn. Plenty of room in the toe box, excellent grip, waterproofing works great. If you need a low profile hiking shoe that can definitely handle trail running, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Mungus

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes and excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: A little tight to start but quickly loosened up. And fits perfect now.
customer_reviews.author: Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Great all around shoes; and waterproof (so far)
customer_reviews.text: I already have the Scarpa Zen and LOVE those but I wanted a waterproof alternative. This are slightly wider than the Zens but I love them anyway. Very comfy and great for all sports, including trail running. They feel solid, not too warm with the Goretex and I was pleasantly surprised with the fact that they are mostly made with recycled materials. Great workmanship.
customer_reviews.author: Maarten

customer_reviews.title: This shoes is perfect for outdoor
customer_reviews.text: This shoes is perfect for outdoor. Firstly, is waterproof and when you drop a heavy. Secondly, and when I drop a kitchen utensil, I don't feel pain. I would recommend anyone who like to hike outside.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Ko

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable first time
customer_reviews.text: I’m 68 and took my sons to Yosemite. I looked at several and this was sooo comfortable hiking. Made the effort quite enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these yellow crocs!
customer_reviews.text: I love the classic crocs, and got tired of only wearing dark blue or khaki. I wore regular shoes for many years, so now it is time for a bit of color in my life. They are great!
customer_reviews.author: G. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my 3rd pair of these shoes. Comfortable fit, they tolerate water quite well, and they're well made and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Quest

product_meta.title: Scarpa Men's Moraine GTX-M, Charcoal/Mustard
feature_bullets: Extended comfort Gore-Tex for protection with maximum breathability
Dual-density compression molded Eva midsole provides ample support and comfort
Tongue lining with stretch Gore-Tex for outstanding fit and comfort in midfoot area
Structured toe box with abrasion-resistant toe rand
